subject: RE: [junit] Q : JUNIT : Java.lang.IllegalAccessError
msgSnippet: Wow. Some suggestions: 1. TestCase extends Assert, so don t write Assert.assertTrue() in your test methods; just write assertTrue(). 2. Do you really want to
messageBody:
Wow.

Some suggestions:

1. TestCase extends Assert, so don't write Assert.assertTrue() in your
test methods; just write assertTrue().

2. Do you really want to add a logger for each test? Maybe this is the
problem. Try removing all the code from the tests and test setup EXCEPT
for the statement that adds a logger. That might be your problem.

3. What's with all the singletons?! Run, don't walk, to my article "Use
Your Singletons Wisely"

http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/webservices/library/co-single.html


4. Replace your assertions with the much, much simpler

assertEquals(0, MaskCollection.getInstance().getSize())

Even better is to add a method to MaskCollection.

assertTrue(MaskCollection.getInstance().isEmpty())

Good luck.

So said Vishal Goyal on 2002-12-19 --------------------
